page.title: 09CUSTOMS.
page.content: One of the annual customs was selling hot cross buns on Good Friday between 4 & 5 a.m. Men would tour around the town selling hot cross buns. May 1st. was a great day for kids. The girls received new dolls and then took them round to friends for them to be admired.The boys would make crosses and then have a competion to see who could decorate it the best with moss,lichen and flowers.The older children celebrated differently.They got up early in the morning and went out to collect primroses.When they had collected a lot they went to the church.While the adults packed the flowers into boxes the children were allowed to have breakfast.The flowers were then sent off to hospitals in London.In one survey 6 out of 10 local people confessed to believe in ghosts.
